definition: for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
back of neck/item/thing/term (in a mathematical formula)/sum (of money)/classifier for principles, items, clauses, tasks, research projects etc

sentences.english: With special renovation, Beijing will again take on the scene it once had, complete with its historical rivers and classical gardens.
sentences.chinese: 通过专项整治，再现京城水系和古典园林的历史风貌。

sentences.english: The projects, commonly known as earmarks, cost billions of dollars.
sentences.chinese: 这些俗称专项拨款的项目会耗费数十亿美元。

sentences.english: They've appealed to the government for money from a special fund to help in the clear-up .
sentences.chinese: 他们已经向政府申请了专项资金推动清理工作。

sentences.english: The transport sector will Silverstrand Fu Xian Xianyang paragraph to carry out special maintenance training.
sentences.chinese: 交通部门将对福银线西安至咸阳段进行专项维修整治。

sentences.english: Fifth, we will launch an extensive campaign to solve production safety problems.
sentences.chinese: 第五，深入开展安全生产专项整治。

sentences.english: Second Xiangya Hospital AIDS Research allowed to participate in the above-mentioned two specific research.
sentences.chinese: 湘雅二医院艾滋病研究室获准参加上述两项专项研究。

sentences.english: A special fund will be launched by the central government to pay these teachers.
sentences.chinese: 中央财政将设专项资金，用于特岗教师的工资性支出。

sentences.english: So they have to conquer the discomfort caused by many-ball training.
sentences.chinese: 多球训练有利于增强专项身体素质。

sentences.english: We asked high school students to particpate in an anti-drug campaign.
sentences.chinese: 我们要求高中学生全程在禁毒专项斗争。

sentences.english: New investments have targeted energy generation and privatized distribution.
sentences.chinese: 新增投资将专项用于能源发电和私有化配电服务。

sentences.english: A special fund can be established to control pollution.
sentences.chinese: 可以建立一项污染控制的专项基金。

sentences.english: Study Guangzhou special funds to private education system.
sentences.chinese: 研究设立广州市民办教育专项资金制度。

sentences.english: The hospital has set up a special fund to buy new equipment.
sentences.chinese: 这家医院已经为购买新设备设立了一个专项基金。

sentences.english: The Municipal People's Government shall set up the Special Funds for Privately-run Education Development.
sentences.chinese: 市政府设立民办教育发展专项资金。

sentences.english: Special funds diverted in serious condition, too many unreasonable expenditures.
sentences.chinese: 挤占专项经费情况严重，不合理支出太多。

sentences.english: Protection of World Ends Symbol should add up the related regulation.
sentences.chinese: 《世标条例》应增设相关的专项条款。

definition: to launch/to develop/to unfold/(of an exhibition etc) to open

leading small group (LSG), a CCP body that exercises general oversight on matters relating to a specific area (LSG for foreign affairs 外事工作, LSG for comprehensively deepening reforms 全面深化改革 etc)/aka central leading group
test point/to carry out trial/pilot scheme
to try harder/to redouble one's efforts
to lead (an animal by the head)/to take the lead/to coordinate (a combined operation)/to mediate/a go-between (e.g. marriage broker)
